intro: Scilla bulgarica, commonly known as the Bulgarian scilla, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Scilla bulgarica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and woodland settings.
